reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Hyatt in Aruba one of the nicest hotels on the island. It was clean. Excellent location to everything. Very tropical feel to it. The ONLY thing I kept asking myself was "Why didn't they put a full balcony instead of that teaser?" Other then that I can't say enough. Would go back in a heartbeat! Weather was outstanding every single day. Being from NY it is such a treat to walk on sand without your feet burning! LOL!!! Water is so nice. A truly great vacation.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to the Hyatt in early Nov 2011 and I was disappointed. My Mom stayed here many years ago and said it was lovely, and the reviews on Tripadvisor seemed to back that up but it really fell short. The overall disappointment lay in their service. We went for a baby moon and I was 6 months pregnant at the time. I couldn’t wait to just sit on the beach and relax. At check in we were told our room was not ready so I asked to change in spa or something (as suggested on Tripadvisor) they just told us no and said there was a bathroom near the beach. Changing your clothes in a bathroom stall at 6 months pregnant is not pretty.. oh well (strike one.) We checked at the cabanan for beach chairs and basically they were booked the whole time we were there. BUT I would still recommend this. If you don’t do it there is a stand slightly to the right of the hotels beach area who will rent you chairs and a umbrella for the exact same cost and he can put them anywhere (even in front of the hotels chairs.) So I would do this if I ever went back. We settled for this large cabana with full shade, not bad and you can drag your chair to sun but not exactly what we wanted. Then the service on the beach slow at best. The thing you have to say is the water is AMAZING! And that will not change. Water is warm and calm and I think I latterly stood in the water and swam around for 4-5 hours each day we were there. Our room was also a let down, we had booked a king but there was none available. So we ended up with two queens and the beds faced away from the ocean so our ocean view was of the neon signs of the strip mall across the street. We could go on the balcony and look to the left and see the ocean but when you book an ocean view room you don’t expect this. We had the breakfast included and the service there was a joke. Some of the waiters almost seemed like they were trying to be rude. We even tipped really well the first day to see what happened the 2nd day, not effect on them. Lastly both the beginning of our trip and end of our trip they had large conventions so the beach was always crowded. So even if you had a reserved spot they would put beach chair right next to you. One day we were there they shut the pool down at 4 to set up for a party for one of the groups, I felt so bad for all the families who were kicked out. Then they were stringing live electrical wires above the pool to set up for the band while my husband was still at the swim up bar… he asked the bartender if the cables were live and they guy just laughed!!! Are you kidding me!!! The beach staff yelled at me a couple of times for bringing my towels back 15 min late (they were still there cleaning) I had watched the sunset and I guess that is not allowed with your towels. The worst part came at the end when the 2nd group that came was an especially rowdy convention and the beach was chair next to chair with people yelling, smoking, playing their radios and parting. We were so grateful this was our last day. We saw some honeymooners whose cabana was locked in by the group and felt so bad.
reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from our 8th consecutive Aruba Hyatt stay, I have nothing but raves!
reviews.title: The Hyatt is a perfect Gem of a Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful room with a perfect pool/ocean view! This hotel is simply the perfect size! Not so huge that you have to hike miles back and forth to your room. Every staff member maintains a friendly, helpful demeanor. Room was spotlessly clean each day. (requested that linens be changed daily). Even the garden walkways are scrubbed clean early each morning!! Got a hut and/or pool lounges daily if we were down there by 8-8:30 which was no big deal. Don't know what the other reviewer was referring to regarding the "quality" of the guests as we travel widely and always remark about what a nicer than average group of people see to frequent the Hyatt!!! Also, the location improves each year, since all the nicest shops, movies theatre and dining spots have moved into the (easily walkable) neighborhood.
reviews.title: Relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt Aruba from July 12 to July 18, 2010. We had an ocean pool room. I can tell you that what the reviews say about the balconies is true! There is no room for a chair to sit out on, which would have been nice. There is only room to stand and look at the views, which was great. The room shampoo and conditioner they have smells like Vicks Vapo Rub. That goodness I brought my own tolietries. They should change their vendor.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel with one noisy icemaker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The gym was good, life fitness machines, they had like 5 elipticals, 4 treadmills and 3 bikes, as well as weights. It was enought for the small crowd in the morning and was clean.
reviews.title: The Full Review - Bleachers at the Old Yankee Stadium! - Management doesn't return phone calls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to many restaurants, so we didn't feel the need to venture too far. We took a cab to El guacho one night, which was a 12 dollar cab ride. The hotel is right across the street from Salt & Pepper, Benihana, Hooters and Wendy's. There are quite a few other restuarants around the area also.
reviews.title: Lovely Grounds, Issues with Room Noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we are preparing to return to the Amazing Aruba Hyatt for our 9th visit this summer, I am realizing I never wrote a review for last summer's wonderful trip. I agree wholeheartedly with the majority of reviewere that this hotel is simply an AMAZINGLY GREAT hotel.
reviews.title: Hyatt Beach Hut Manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously, for us to plan an annual visit, we love the property, the staff and Aruba.
reviews.title: Most beautiful hotel in Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: We have not had the greatest experience with the man who runs their towel hut on the beach, however. As the years have passed, he seems to become less willing to help with simple situations. Case in point, we could almost never get a float to use in the ocean on our last visit. Although we got out there early and made several return trips to request a float, he was in no way helpful. Finally, when I complained the I was an annual guest and had never seen so few floats, he sent a worker to get me one from the group stored in some storage container which he didn't want to bother to bring out each day!!!!! I watched to see where the float came from and there were MANY more in that container! So, although the Hyatt DID own many more floats, this man who is paid to run the beach hut gets to decide how many floats to bring to the paying guests??!!! Something is wrong with picture.
reviews.title: Good location, but EXPENSIVE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a HUGE fan of this hotel and will surely return, but this is a bad situation and Hyatt should correct this.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hyatt Regency Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband & I flew to Aruba for 4 nights for a winter getaway. When we stepped into the lobby of the hotel, we were greeted by the friendly staff with champagne and escorted up to our gorgeous, oceanfront king room. If you like sitting on a balcony, as opposed to just standing on the "french" balconies, this room category is for you! The hotel grounds are just amazing! Yes, it is crazy to get up at 6:30am in order to reserve a palapa, but we reserved it before our trip and paid the $35/day. It was totally worth it for us because of the shade it provided and also because we prefer the beach to the pool. If you decide to pay for one, make sure to place other items on the chairs, like a book or shoes. Towels are not enough! There was a family of 5 enjoying our palapa in the early morning before we got there around 10:00. Evidently, towels on the beach chairs aren't enough of a clue for people that it's reserved.
reviews.title: reserving beach chairs and beach huts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family and I have been coming to the Hyatt Aruba on and off for 20 years and annually for the last 5. There are 14 of us and we get 4 rooms. We visit during February break when school is out in the Northeast. If you value your peace and quiet (and sanity) look elsewhere. We will not be returning next year...as we finally hit our limit. Where to begin...
reviews.title: AVOID DURING SCHOOL BREAKS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check in is always an adventure and takes 3x as long as it should because there is always arguing over the coveted free breakfast. Every year we book the AAA rate with the breakfast and every year they argue with us and claim we did not book the breakfast (even though our confirm says so). This year, I argued for a few minutes and gave up. My sister got hers immediately. After stewing about it, I got annoyed and went back down for round 2 of arguing ...by round 3, I got the breakfast. My other family members who were staying for 13 nights had the pleasure of arguing for 13 days. On the final day, they asked 1 more time (it had become a family joke and there was someone working the desk whom they'd never seen before) and were told, "sure, no problem...we'll take the breakfasts off your bill. BTW, check out is worse, it's known among guests that you need to ask for your bill the day before because it takes half a day to argue about the incorrect charges. My bill started out over $800 high and it took me 3 trips to the desk to work it out.
reviews.title: Paradise Found!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rugs in my room were badly stained (big red stains). There is clear glass between the bathroom and the room, so every time someone gets up in the night to use the bathroom, it disturbs everyone. Beds are actual Queens...nice size.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are nice and the Hyatt occupies and enviable spot on the beach, however, the crowds during break are too much. You have to rent your spot on the beach for $50 per day and they are spoken for 12 months in advance. It is based on seniority and it's easier to get a table at Rao's in NY. I heard a guy say, "I don't even like coming here anymore, but if I go somewhere else I lose my seniority." That's what made me decide to be done with this nonsense!! It is so crowded that you have to climb on chairs to get to the water.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: At night, the lobby becomes a teenage hangout. Kids come from other hotels just to roam around the Hyatt lobby.
reviews.title: Super great hotel
Not worth the money!
reviews.text: Over-Rated! OLD! Hotel needs up-dating. Rooms are not worth the money they charge, old bathrooms, and tiles are worn and dirty, including tub. Terraces are not more than 6" wide, rediculous....Getting a hut on the beach is racing down by 7:00AM to reserve, if not, you lose! People take them and never return after hours of waiting. Water is Murcky because of Rentals on beach, alot of blurr and seaweed! Service is so slow. Food is ok, nothing to write hime about. Pools have overgrown trees, and no restrooms nearby, so guess where everyones' going! NO music near pool or beaches. NO ENTERTAINMENT bREEZE IF fREE! THATS ABOUT IT! Way overpriced! Casino's are OLD. Cancun KILLS ARUBA! If I want a Casino, anywhere else is better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: Just returned from 7 days/nights at the Hyatt Regency Aruba. We really liked it. It has a very nice beach that has a lot of people on it but nonetheless does not feel too crowded. There are huts (basically large permanent thatch umbrellas) across the beach that can be reserved early each morning. There are many water sports available at the beach, and both sailing/snorkeling and diving trips leave from 3 piers within a one- to five-minute walk. There is also a pool with numerous different areas and a large children's water slide. The hotel has four good restaurants, including one casual one and three more elegant ones (American, Asian, and Italian). The grounds are beautiful and are well maintained, there is excellent security and staff, and overall we were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel.
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2005
reviews.text: Just returned from 6day stay, first time at the Hyatt,4th time in Aruba. Weather sensational as always. Very nice accomadations, however if you are looking for space at the beach or around the pool - FORGET IT. The staff assigns chairs and huts starting as 7am(no sooner) for the pool and at the beach. You CAN NOT just go and get chairs for the day first thing in the morning. We did not even go to the pool area because you are inches away from the next chair, and there is a 12" walkway at the bottom of your chair for people to walk through. This is around the entire pool no matter where you go! My husband got up a couple of mornings to get a hut on the beach, was there in line at 5am, and he was not even the first one in line. Ridiculous!!!! For the size of the Hyatt - the pool and beach area are way, way too small. Have stayed at the Divi and LaCabana, both beat the Hyatt by far for Beach and Poolside comfort!!!!
reviews.title: Beach and pool way to small
The Hyatt is the best!
reviews.text: Just returned from the Hyatt for the sixth consecutive year and wouldn't look or stay at any other hotel, the staff is like family to us, the Aruba people are so warm and friendly and the hotel is beautiful. The restaurants in the Hyatt are wonderful and there are so many on the island that are also wonderful, you just have to go to see for yourself.

reviews.title: Loved It Loved It Loved It
reviews.text: Look forward to returning again Feb. 2006.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Great location, we had a fantastic time with everything that's needed located at the resort and great restaurants in the vicinity. The Hotel stay was very enjoyable and we loved it.
reviews.title: Great spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a very beautiful and recently remodeled property on Palm Beach. It is right at the beginning of the hotel district, and it is within walking distance of many restaurants and shops. When I arrived I found it odd that there was no one at the door to greet me, and I had to carry my own bags to the long line at the reception desk. The lobby was marble and quite breathtaking, but that did not get me over the fact that I was still dragging my luggage around.
reviews.title: Nice Place, but the only thing 5 star is the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since there was a reservation mix-up, I ended up in a "smoking" room near the casino. I dreaded this, but the air purifying system was state of the art. I never smelled smoke, but the noise from the casino was annoying at times. The room service menu was very limited, and the value vs. the quality of the food was not good. The breakfast buffet was good, but the service was spotty. As everyone has mentioned, it is hard to get a chair on the beach. Many people just put their towels down on the sand near the water. The spa services are virtually non-existent, so you have to go to the Marriott if you want a package. All of this sounds quite bad, but the property is beautiful and the rooms are decent. I enjoyed the on site Starbucks coffee, and the small market next door had everything I needed. The restaurants are not great, but there are many other choices right across the street. The entire time I was there I got the impression that the staff thought they were entitled to be nonchalant due to the greatness of their surroundings. Pretty is good, but customer service will keep us coming back. This was my 4th time in Aruba, but my first time in this hotel. If you are looking to be centrally located on a pretty beach this hotel has what you want. If you are looking for 5 star food or service you will not find it there.
reviews.title: Nice resort - mediocre value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights here in February 2012 (we also spent two nights at the Westin during this trip). As far as the high rise hotels went, this was definately the nicest (the hotels on the beach are all next to each other and are open, so we were able to walk into all of them). The one restaurant that we ate at on the properly (Palms) was reasonably priced for lunch and had very good food. Beach chairs and floats were easy to check out with plenty of options for sun and shade. The staff, and particularly the concierge team were very knowledgable and helpful.
reviews.title: nice resort, crowded beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While overall, this is a very nice resort, at the price point, we have found better value and ambiance at other resorts in the Bahamas and Riviera Maya, Mexico. We felt that the hotel was trying to nickel and dime where possible with examples as charging a ridiculous fee for wifi and keeping track of towels checked out and charging for unreturned towels.
reviews.title: Rembering A great Trip
Our second trip to the Hyatt in one month!!!
reviews.text: Our second trip to the Hyatt and to Aruba was even more enjoyable than our first trip which was definitely NOT LONG ENOUGH!! After many trips to several tropical vacations spots, Aruba by far exceeds other vacation places. First of all, Aruba is a very safe, clean island. The people there are very friendly. No one ever had their hand out for a tip. The hair braiders on the beach were tasteful and non-pushy. The people in Aruba are very content. Their peace is definitely conveyed to all the tourists.

reviews.title: Hyatt/Aruba outstanding
reviews.text: Had a great time at the Hyatt, once again. The staff there was wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: A special employee named Xiomara guaranteed our two rooms together and gave us special treatment since we were return guests. Thank you to her and all the staff for a great week.
reviews.title: save money, time and headaches
Whats up with the reviews?
reviews.text: The Hyatt restaurants were all great. My husband and I did the "Pampered in Paradise" dinner on the beach. How romantic to enjoy a delicious dinner as the sun sets. The Palms restaurant had a fajita night with great food and a live Mariachi band. What a hit!

reviews.title: This hotel was beautiful
reviews.text: Every night there was a live band, kareoke, gambling. We were very content enjoying the great music and fun. Our four kids totally enjoyed the pool, restaurants, and very friendly Arubian people. We walked the beach at night and found the Hyatt was the only hotel with any life at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose the Hyatt for our honeymoon and were so pleased. After reading reviews online and speaking with our travel agent, we felt this was our best bet. The hotel lobby is beautiful; it's the only open air lobby hotel on the island and this is such a nice touch! The pool area is beautiful too-lots of palm trees, foliage, flowers etc. We walked to other resorts and checked out their pool areas and lobbies and none came even close to the beauty of the Hyatt. The hotel is very clean -it has a chic, modern feel that the other resorts lack. We went to the concierge each morning and she booked us dinner reservations each night. Our suggestions for very romantic restaurants: Mirandi, Papiamento and Flying Fishbone. The only negative thing is most of the restaurants at the Hyatt and off the resort are very expensive. Also taxi rides are pretty expensive and it can cost you $70 just in taxi fares! All in all we loved the Hyatt and after seeing other resorts we felt that if we went back we would only stay there.
reviews.title: By far the nicest hotel in Aruba!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: In June/July 2010 my wife, daughter (age 9), and myself visited Aruba for the first time. We stayed at the Hyatt hotel on the wonderful Palm Beach. If I had to sum up the trip in one word it would be: Outstanding!
reviews.title: An Outstanding Resort and Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The details...
reviews.title: HEAVEN ON EARTH :)
BEWARE OF FALSE ADVERTISING!!!
reviews.text: -The Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. We went in the "off season" for Aruba and were upgraded to a pool/ocean view room on the eighth floor. The view of the pool and sparkling blue ocean were fabulous. The room itself was exceptionally clean and had a modern decor. Also, when a group of noisy teenage girls moved in next door on the second to last day of our stay the management quickly agreed to move us to another (and even better) room location.
reviews.title: No Other Aruba Hotel I'd Rather Stay In

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let us start by saying that the grounds of this resort are absolutely gorgeous -- by far, the nicest grounds on Palm Beach! The grounds are lushly tropical, with colorful birds, koi, black swans, and iguanas. There are three outdoor bars, including a swim-up bar in the pool, as well as three indoor/outdoor restaurants. There is also a juice/smoothie bar located right by the beach! We can't say enough good things about the outside amenities at this resort. The rooms are nice, but the bathroom was on the small side. We've found that most Hyatt resorts have very large bathrooms, allowing a couple to be in there at the same time. This was not the case in our room. Please know that most rooms have a garden/ocean view from the balconies; however very few rooms actually have a "real" balcony with chairs that you can sit on. We were lucky to have gotten upgraded to a "sit-down" balcony room, as most of the "balconies" are only deep enough to stand on (about two feet deep). Maybe because we had the sit-down balcony the space was taken from the bathroom? Not sure, because we didn't ask to see another room. The room itself was sufficiently large and the decor was nice enough. The maintenance of our room, however, left a lot to be desired at a $700 per night price tag. The shower door (which was a beautiful frameless glass) was all scraped up from people slamming it and it didn't close all the way, which meant a flooded bathroom every time we took showers unless we used all of our hand towels to build a dam outside the bottom of the shower door. Luckily, the maid service was great and provided us with plenty of towels after they could see what we had to do with them. As a result of this water problem, the grouting between the floor tiles in the bathroom was missing in many places and was in terrible need of regrouting. The wallpaper in the bathroom was also peeling in several places. In the main area of the room, one of the wall sconces on either side of the large full-length mirror was loose and the desk area didn't have a light, which would have been helpful. The soundproofing of the room could also stand some improvement, as it could be noisy at times with people coming and going and letting their hotel room doors drop closed. On the upside, our view of the Caribbean was fabulous! Our air conditioning worked very well, the water pressure was great, and a ceiling fan is always a nice amenity. We utilized the spa for a couples massage and the masseuses were great. The facility was nice, although it was small and didn't offer many amenities other than a steam room, which didn't even sound appealing given the humid environment of Aruba. We were also amazed to find that the spa's indoor/outdoor relaxation area and treatment rooms are located right next to the children's slide by the main outdoor pool. So, if relaxing and having a couples massage at $290 (pre-tip) with kids screaming outside is acceptable to you, then the services were fine. We, however, would have preferred a different location for the spa. We made a reservation for Hyatt's "Footprints" upscale dining experience on the beach (only about five to seven tables). This dining experience includes a four course meal at $72 per person, which includes a choice of appetizer, salad, main course, and dessert. The portions were surprisingly large, tasty, and very well prepared and presented. After the server accepted our order for a $50 bottle of wine, delivered it, and poured it, she then told us that a glass of wine was included with our meal and that she would bring them after we finished our bottle. After asking her why we were not informed of this prior to ordering a whole bottle of wine and that it was not included on the menu, her only explanation was that we should have been told when we made our reservation. We later checked our online reservation confirmation and there was nothing mentioned about any wine being included. We just let this go, although we probably shouldn't have. We are Hyatt lovers but, given the whole package for the Hyatt Regency Resort & Casino Aruba, we cannot bring ourselves to give it five stars.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Grounds, Room Needed Maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We visited friends staying at the Hyatt (we are staying at the Radisson) today with our children. Our 6 year old son wanted to go on the water slide with our friends children but the attendant of the water slide told him he couldn't as we weren't guests at that hotel. In checking further into the matter we were told that was policy- so both families left and went to the Radisson where our children where not harassed. I would not recommend any hotel that would be callous to a child but the Hyatt in Aruba doesn't seem to really care about it's guests.
reviews.title: Guests?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed with my family over spring break, we had a great time. The rooms were good, bathroom large in comparison with room space but comfortable and clean
reviews.title: Great experience, perfect location, very nice hotel, friendly and prepared staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Overall Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: - Location, location, location. In the best Aruba beach also walking distance to many other stores, restaurants, casinos and the Paseo mall
reviews.title: Beautiful Aruban Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being used to spending hard earned vacation time at five star resorts (Ritz Carlton, etc.), we were a bit skeptical when our travel agent suggested the Hyatt Regency Aruba. I've always thought of Hyatts as more the type of generic hotel you would stay at for a convention in Chicago than a Carribean vacation.
reviews.title: Much more than one would expect from a Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were so very wrong! The Hyatt Regency in Aruba easily bested any five star luxury resort. It was recently renovated and easily the nicest resort on the island. The public areas had a chic- almost boutique- like quality and the rooms were immaculate and comfortable. The beach was beautiful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Many seem to make comparisons between the Marriott Stellaris and the Hyatt. In my opinion, the two are not even close in level of luxury. The Marriott felt somewhat pedestrian and small. In the words of one of the staff members at the Hyatt, "it's a very different product."
reviews.title: Friendly staff, beautiful hotel and beach, across the street from mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much has been made on this site about the beach cabana assignments at the Hyatt. We were told by guests who returned to the Hyatt yearly that $100 given to the woman at the assignment hut would ensure that we would get good service. Sure enough, a prime front row palapa was awaiting us each day before we even arrived at the beach. This is a flawed system.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Pros- Beautiful facility. Pretty grounds. Nice mix of people. Rooms are adequate is size with amazing rain shower bathrooms and cool decor. Staff is usually very friendly and helpful. Beach is gorgeous. Fitness center is very nice. Centrally located.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, shame about the palapa's and chairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided on Aruba for a long-weekend 20th anniversary get away and the Hyatt Regency did not disappoint. We were greeted with champagne and a hearty "Happy anniversary!" We stayed on the Concierge Floor and I would say it was totally worth it. They sent us a lovely note congratulating us on our anniversary, a nice bottle of champagne and a beautiful chocolate dessert - twice! The food on the Concierge floor is terrific - great breakfast, great snacks, great pre-dinner fare. The rooms are nice sized, quiet, clean and comfortable to hang out in, the bathrooms clean and well appointed, The balcony is small, but you can stand on it. My only caveat would be to avoid the Ruins del Mar Restaurant for dinner, beautiful setting, but the food is boringly ordinary. The Hyatt Regency made us feel like important honored guests and really what more could you want from a hotel?
reviews.title: Fabulous, perfect slice of paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hyatt is a nice looking resort with very nice ambiance. But like other reviews, very expensive. $50 for a bucket of 6 beers....$22 for breakfast buffet and sorry, my kids cannot eat $22 dollars worth of pancakes. But you can easily find decent restaurants within walking distance. My biggest beef with this place was the lack of internet. They charge $35 a week for internet PER DEVICE!!! With 4 people that is simply unacceptable. And when you question the ridiculousness of it, they blame "the internet provider" which is laughable since all the other resorts provide it for free. They do have a coffee shop which supposedly supplies free internet service which worked 50% of the time. The concierge is A+ and extremely helpful. On the flip side, it did force us to "unplug" which in the wake of the marathon bombing was a good thing. It was a great lesson for my kids to be unattached to their texting but it still bothered me the gauging they were trying to get away with. As far as the beach, we were told to be there by 6:00am to get a good chair with a "palm hut". Well we were on vacation and not about to get up that early. We ended up renting a car and going to more beautiful secluded beaches and LOVED it. The kids liked the pools and the bars were very nice but again, prepare for high prices.
reviews.title: No internet beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here as a family of 4 with children aged 9 and 6 for six nights. This was not the "get away from it all" Caribbean vacation we'd hoped for.
reviews.title: Island High Rise Catering to Corporate Groups and Meetings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was tight and lacked the slightest trace of a Caribbean feel. Expect cookie cutter accommodations in a high rise tower, the kind found at an airport hotel. Two queen beds filled the space without an inch to spare. And going outside to enjoy the warm air lost its charm after a moment of standing on the tiny balcony. Our best night’s sleep was in our own beds after returning home because our room, like more than half of the Hyatt’s rooms, look across the pools and grounds but also over Alfresco, the cocktail lounge featuring live music every night. The kids were tired by 9 but unable to sleep until hours later when the cocktail lounge band called it quits, forcing us to lay awake in bed listening to awful covers of Neil Diamond songs like Sweet Caroline booming across the grounds while a couple drunken guests sang along. Worse, the acoustics in the hallways meant we were repeatedly awoken by loud voices and slamming doors as waves of guests filtered back to their rooms through the night and early morning.
reviews.title: Very Nice Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would’ve stayed up later had there been anything for the kids to do other than watch TV in the room. The hotel has no scheduled activities for kids whatsoever, though the game room in the basement with coin-operated video games and a ping pong table held their interest one evening.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the facilities, not the prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Even before we arrived, Aida in reservations was great. Daniel, the manager at the front desk, was a wonderful help in setting up our visit for maximum comfort. We got an upgrade to a lovely ocean view room with a nice, roomy bathroom. We had a long wait for our room, so they provided a complimentary lunch for us, as well. The concierge desk was very helpful and gave us good recommendations for meals.
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a nice vacation and the staff handled everything well despite being at full capacity. We really appreciate the added touches of the room upgrade and complimentary meals. It made our visit even better!! We love Hyatt properties and this one did not disappoint.Thank you!!
reviews.title: Hyatt is the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay! The wife and I have stayed here several times over the years. We have always found the food excellent... Fantastic location... Great facility.... Outside recreation area very well done. Casino is great place to contribute to local economy.... Would recommend this Hyat for lodging, dining and gaming....
reviews.title: A beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited in December and the weather did not cooperate. I rained the entire trip which is no refection on the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and has most anything you need. Bars, restaurants and a helpful concierge. If you like Aruba I would recommend this hotel. Personally I find Aruba a bit too commercial. From our garden view balcony we had an ocean view to the left and a view of a Wendy's sign on my right. I prefer something a bit more secluded.
reviews.title: Relax and Enjoy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service, Pool, Beach, Grounds and Food ALL OUTSTANDING!!...25 minute taxi ride to airport...many packages include a phenominal breakfast in a beautiful lagoon setting...Restaurants are within walking distance or just hop into a taxi for generally a minimal fare....everyone is friendly INCLUDING the talking birds....Vacation Paradise for us
reviews.title: Great Stay, Top Notch Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We just returned from the Hyatt and loved it. This was our second trip to Aruba - stayed at the Marriott last time and liked the Hyatt much better. The lobby and grounds have a wonderful feel. The resort is large but not overly so and functions like a more intimate property. The outdoor bar is close to pool AND beach plus there is a swim up bar to handle the pool crowd.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing I liked was the furniture in lobby, around outdoor bar, etc. All of the seating is large and definitely designed to encourage groups to sit and visit,drink, eat, etc. There was also plenty of it.
reviews.title: Loved the location, not keen on the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service and staff were excellent. I have no complaints. In fact, every day as I left for the beach, I noticed three housekeepers on my floor preparing to clean for the day. Front desk was always helpful.
reviews.title: You Don't Get What You Pay For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ate at the new restaurant Mexicado which was very good. Great guacamole and good entrees. I recommend.
reviews.title: Aruba for New Year's eve!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: One place I think the Hyatt needs to give attention is the pool/beach bathroom. There is only one bathroom for the entire pool/beach area/outdoor bar/palms restaurant(at lower level). As you can imagine, this is a busy place. The whole 8 days we were there, one toilet was out of service and one of the soap dispensers never worked. The bathroom was cleaned with regularity which was great - no complaints - but it could use one of those automatic air fresheners. The smell was never terrible but was not great either. An air freshener would help.
reviews.title: luxury, location and service top notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for 7 nights for our honeymoon. We walked by all of the high rise hotels and thought the Hyatt had the best grounds, very tropical. Our room was on the 7th floor (ocean/pool side) and had amazing views of the hotel grounds, beach and ocean). It was probably the best hotel we've ever stayed in. We were originally looking for an all-inclusive after a good experience staying at Sandals Montego Bay but glad we picked the Hyatt.... it was way better than Sandals. The room was very clean, service was great and the restaurants were very good. I wanted a larger balcony but the one we had was plenty to enjoy the views. I was able to get a beach hut every morning by just walking up around 7:30 am, no waiting.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started every morning with a very good breakfast buffet at Ruinas Del Mar with the swans and fish swimming by (they also have great freshly squeezed orange juice). We liked Footprints at the Hyatt for dinner one night (semi-private dining on the beach at sunset). We also both enjoyed the fruit smoothies at the juice bar. You can order drinks and lunch right on the beach from one of the waiters walking around, which we did a couple times...very convenient.
reviews.title: Flippin Unbelievable!!!!! Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we went the first week of June there were barely any children there... nothing against kids but we were there on our honeymoon.
reviews.title: *****5Stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aruba is a great island to visit, very safe and very unique with the desert-like landscape at the national park. You should NOT leave Aurba without taking a jeep tour through the national park. Aruba also has some great restaurants, with most offering outdoor seating. Our favorites were Papiamento (romantic poolside tables), Screaming Eagle, Texas de Brazil, Flying Fishbone (sat with our feet in the water), and Madame Jeanettes. If you're staying at the Hyatt a great place for a reasonable lunch is Salt & Pepper (across the street).
reviews.title: can not wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was our favorite hotel and destination, highly recommend both the island and the hotel!! We can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Better than expected, fantastic location close to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we have been staying at the Aruba Hyatt for many years, the front desk has never made us aware that we can upgrade to the Regency Floor using our "points". A recent guest on this site states that she upgraded her four night stay for ony 3000 pts. Why would I not be made aware of this when I check in and request an upgrade and have already poid for the top-price "Island/Pool View" room?
reviews.title: Upgrade to Regency Club for Points??!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were in Aruba for a work conference for 3+ days. We got there early (noon-ish) and our room wasn't ready. Apparently, they had blocked off certains rooms for our group and, although another room was available, they wanted us to wait. (The reason for the 4/5 instead of 5/5 rating.) After over an hour sitting with nothing to do (all our swimsuits and such were in our bags that had been taken from us at the airport), I talked them into letting us have another room. We didn't mind that we weren't on the sixth floor. Our fourth floor room was just fine. It overlooked the courtyard and was a bit loud at night, but that wasn't awful.
reviews.title: Very happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our breakfasts were really good (Ruinas del Mar Restaurant). We had a reception on the first night and the service and food for 200+ was outstanding. Ditto for a banquet on the last night. (We ate out at El Gaucho, an Argentine steak restaurant in town, the second night and it was superb. Make reservations when you get to the hotel or you might not get in. It's worth the taxi and the price. Awesome food.)
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach was clean and not crowded although the hotel was full. The pool was beautiful as well. We took a Jeep excursion into the Arikok National Park and had a blast. Ask the concierge to set you up for that, too.
reviews.title: Much better than anticipated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt for a week and were very happy. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The staff is very helpful..the rooms are beautiful. The beach was amazing...we had everything that we needed.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place had vey nice grounds, casino, restaurants and pools with a great location right on the beach. It's convenient to plenty of dining and water sports, all a short walk away. Rented a hobie cat right on the beach in front of the hotel and the palapas on the beach were key for shade. We did the sunset dining on the beach one time and it was gorgeous. One night, my wife went to bed early and I went down to the beach myself w/ a fine cigar and a couple beers, sat under a palapa and actually fell asleep listening to the music from the bar down the way. No where have i been where you could actually do this and not get mugged. We had a great time here and felt very safe.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay & Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nice, but seemed a bit small. The balconies are very tiny, don't plan on sitting or hanging out on it, too small. Very clean and tidy though.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Paradise
ARUBA IS BEAUTIFUL AND A FUN ISLAND
reviews.text: We just returned from the Hyatt in Aruba. Great location, great staff - a friendly hotel on a friendly Island. We were upgraded upon arrival to an ocean front suite - what a surpise for us. Check in starts with a glass of champagne - when we got to our room I was swept away! The room had a great full balcony directly facing the beach and beach walk. It was great to end our day with drink in hand toasting the sunset. It was also great to just sit out and people watch since so many people walk, jog on the beach walk each morning. Each morning we had a second cup of coffee outside before getting ready for the beach. What a setting, like a picture postcard. Can't say enough for the staff - from room service to housekeeping, The beach folks really know how to spoil guests. Drinks, lunch, floats - whatever you need, all you have to do is ask.

reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, lovely location. Great hospitality.
reviews.text: We loved the 3 level pool area, and ended our day there after the beach. The swim-up bar is right by the pool slide and volley ball net. This didn't make sense to us, but others didn't seem to mind. Also, the pool lift actually worked here, so my partner could enter the pool himself. He loved it and promises to return next January again.l

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The casino is small, and the slot machines did get boring after some time. But No problem with getting seats at the blackjack tables after returning from dinner each night. They always had all their tables opened in the evenings. Live bands played also at night, I did find them a bit loud, but others seemed to enjoy the music while they gambled. Made for a very party atmosphere.
reviews.title: the best hotel in aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me say we have stayed at this hotel every year for the past ten years and LOVE it! Perhaps the occupancy rates vary greatly week by week, but we had absolutely NO problems getting poolside lounges in sun or shade anytime during each day we were there! Some days, we had chairs at the ocean also no problem any time of the day. (Huts are scarce after about 8:30am, but that isn't terribly early). That said, the FLOAT situation is horrific!! Come on, Hyatt!! What a small investment to purchase 100 new floats for your highpaying, loyal guests and throw away the old, damaged floats you're now using!! It's embarrassing that most days we had to pay $5. for Delphi Watersports to get a float and yet I am paying the Hyatt top dollar to be a guest in their hotel!!?? Also, dear Hyatt Manager, there HAS to be a way to store a larger number of floats on your property and have your beach staff bring them out each morning!!! This may seem like a small point to management, but we hear guests complaining about this every, single day we are there!! It makes guests feel unappreciated!
reviews.title: Slice of Paradise...except minor complaint....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the good news...the hotel property is truly a little gem of perfection and is continuously maintained and improved. The birds on site are a joy to see and the birds that talk are especially delightful! The staff in always friendly and helpful. (only one exception, oddly, was at the concierge desk, where Ariana seemed to need an attitude adjustment! This has happened in past years with her also, so that should be looked at!) On the other hand, I'd like to give a thank you to Melisa, at the front desk who repeatedly helped me with a wifi issue and was patient and fabulous!! Our favorite bartender, Aison/aka Addison is the BEST! He made us our first rumrunner there 10 years ago and took such good care of us this visit that is just another reason to go back to the Hyatt!! He is friendly and informative and a joy to see each year! There is something very nice about the continuity of staff over the years we've visited!
reviews.title: not the same hyatt ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keep up the good work...we'll be back!! (hopefully to enjoy nicer and more plentiful "floats")
reviews.title: Nice but just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ill would like to coment that is a hyatt property just on the name , guess why i tell this .
reviews.title: ZOIA SPA is wonderful!
Dated and tired
reviews.text: All the staff at this hotel it seem to give you a favor, i said all the staff , not sameones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely go back everything was excellent from the time we checked in we were welcomed with a glass of champagne and a cold moist towellette.The BEST part is not a lot of running kids-teenagers and college kidsi,t's quiet and relaxing,and check out time you can leave your luggage in the lobby go back to the beach or pool and use the SPA to shower and change.The pool have a nice tall slide.The breakfast buffet were delicious plenty of variety.The hotel room have a ceiling fan,refrigerator ,a ipod docking clock\radio and eucalyptus Portico body wash,shampoo,conditioner.Use of lounge chair and float is free but the negative part is getting up at 6am to reserved a hut BUT there are plenty of vacant hut anytime,there's a towel hut on the beach ( Tessy and Hector they're the best)you don't need to bring anything just your sunblock,there's free water near the bar station,they have the best tasting water btw.Nightime there's a lot of restaurant across the hotel and Plaza Herencia is a short walk,there's a grocery store near McDonald's.Disappointed at Texas Churrascaria it's overhyped.The bus to town is just outside the hotel but we didn't go we're happy where we were.One night we walked from one hotel to another just to check and compare we still love Hyatt.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel with a perfect location. The hotel grounds are stunning to look at and the rooms are clean and modern. We ate at 4 of the on-site restaurants and didn't have a bad meal-- Footprints menu is somewhat limited, but dining on the beach at sunset is an unforgettable experience. The hotel staff are accomodating, everyone was very friendly and professional. If you'd like to take a tour through Red Sail Sports, the desk is located adjacent to the lobby and you can sign up the day before your selected tour. We did the luncheon snorkel with 3 stops and LOVED it. We also took a half day island tour that included Natural Pool-- an adventurer's paradise! The hotel is in a great area of town where you feel safe walking to strip malls, restaurants, etc. It's also just a short bus or taxi ride to downtown Oranjestad. We only used US currency-- everyone spoke English. This trip was just so easy, there's no reason not to return.
reviews.title: So beautiful, so easy, so unforgettable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt June 4-8th. Everything about this hotel was good. The grounds/pool area is the best by far on the island. It was always clean, with lots of pool/beach attendants. The food we had here was very good (especially to american standards). We did eat dinner out 3 nights, and did not have a meal close to the quality we had at the hotel. We thought by eating offsite it would be cheaper, but that was not the case. We ate at Scala and the japanese restaurant the the mall across the street-both over priced. Also, very hard to understand anyone offsite-we had to repeat ourselves over and over again, and sometimes still got our order wrong.
reviews.title: Best of Aruba, everyone there great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at the hotel went out of there way to accomodate us with every wish and need. Lots of smiles all around.
reviews.title: Best property on the island!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful property, friendly staff - great stay! Would go back in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Exceptional Stay in Relaxing Aruba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hyatt in Aruba is a very nice hotel. Our only gripe was that we were told by the Hyatt booking agent that our 1 bedroom suite would have a private bedroom and that our kids could sleep on the sofa bed. This was absolutely false and of course when I brought it to the attention of the front desk and manager, they were full and could do nothing. We have 10 and 12 year old boys and only travel with connecting rooms or private bedroom suites. It is not a vacation if you have to share "everything" with your kids. Nothing was done for us except an offer to let us pay for another room opening up the next day, but not connecting. I may be an overly protective American, but having my 10 and 12 year olds in their own room down the hall in a foreign country sounded scary to me - no thanks.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but poor booking info.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positives of this hotel are many. It is an attractive hotel with nicely maintained indoor and outdoor areas. The Regency club was well staffed and stocked daily for breakfast, drinks and late afternoon snacks. The pool and beach were nice and well taken care of. The 2 main restaurants were decent, but nothing special. There are definitely better restaurants around for good meals. The cleaning staff was excellent and most of the concierge staff were helpful. Red Sail Sports offers a nice mix of activities and they have a rep on site. There are several nice restaurants within walking distance of this hotel that are tasty (Aqua Grill, Texas de Brazil, Gelatissimo) and an excellent steak place a bit farther called El Gaucho. Wake up early if you like to reserve umbrellas at the beach or the pool - they are gone by 730 am. Overall a good experience, but make sure you confirm what type of room you need and what you end up getting.
reviews.title: Another fantastic and luxurious stay at the Hyatt...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 3rd trip to the Hyatt in Aruba, it has become my mainstay. I have tried some of the other more pretigious islands and they in no way embody the friendliness, cleanliness, and lush beauty of the Hyatt Regency. For me, returning to a resort that is immaculately kept and lush with flowers, greenery, black swans, and exotic birds is pure bliss. Let's not forget incredible food and service! But what really draws us back is the kindness and friendliness of the Hyatt staff and Management. From Cordeila and Edwin at the swim up bar to Jacky, Karen, and Sharmila in Concierge who will work to find you ANYTHING that you need, you feel as though you have a slew of people at your fingertips who purely want to make sure that you are having a wonderful time and the best stay possible. I cannot say enough about Richard, the Manager of the resort. He truly is invested in his guests. How many resort managers ask you how an outing was, or if you enjoyed your dinner? I think this is what is so special about the Hyatt in Aruba, you never feel as though you are in "a resort", instead you feel as though you have just escaped to comfort and luxury. Your wish is their command. I am already looking forward to my next rejuvinating stay, whether it is a week or just a long weekend, it never fails to be special.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for Aruba, but don't recommend for romantic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms were ok size, but furniture was dated. Grounds were very nice but we found it too busy with lots of kids. Restaurants were ok...we are disappointed with breakfast. Service was excellent. Note: book palapas when you book hotel if you want one near the water (or at all)!
reviews.title: Perfect family vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hyatt with our two girls, ages 8 and 6. What a great place to stay! We had looked at other hotels but for some reason the Hyatt looked to be the nicest, and we were right! Beautiful from the drive up all the way to the beach. Each employee was accommodating and friendly and our room was nice. If you do want a cabana close to the water,you do need to be in line to reserve at 6:10am. Otherwise the pool is a beautiful option. This is a place where we would definitely come back!!
reviews.title: Very nice and large hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great time in Aruba. The Hyatt was very accommodating for my family. The room clean and comfortable, the staff was great and the beach was steps away. My children loved the pool and the birds. The camp was not what they advertised. They did not do much and it seemed more of a babysitting service. My only complaint of the room was the bathroom could of used a little more light and lastly, the one other annoying thing was having to get up extra early to wait on line for floats for the beach. We would definitely stay here again even with the few annoyances.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with a great vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great property! Perhaps the best part of the hotel is not what is in the hotel itself but rather the grounds and more important the beach front.
reviews.title: Fantastic beach at a top notch resort. Well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The registration area is out in the open with the trade winds blowing strongly through it. It is usually warm and breezy in the lobby area, but its plenty cool in the rooms and casino.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools and outdoor area of the hotel are well kept, beautiful and serene. There are several connected pools, a waterslide and two hot tubs. The water is warm and refreshing in all. There’s even a swim up bar where you can order drinks, bar food and watch TV.
reviews.title: Even Better the 2nd Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beachfront is excellent. The sand is soft, the beach is very clean and calm. Being on the west side of the island the water is not subject to the pounding surf, so the water is very clear and the ocean floor smooth, a perfect set up for snorkeling. There are plenty of umbrellas and shady areas. The staff makes certain sunbathers are taken care of. There are also lots of water toys there and opportunities for windsurfing, sailing, parasailing, snorkeling, etc. at the Piet’s Pier dock adjacent to the hotel. If you like to sunbathe and do water sports, you cannot go wrong here…the opportunities for an excellent time are endless.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went to Aruba with hubby and our 17 month old son. On our arrival we were told that we were upgraded to their Regency Club and was asked to proceed to the 9th floor to check in. We stayed at Room 937 which had a great view of the beach. The employees were all so friendly and seemed to truly enjoy being of service to their guests. Breakfast was good and the food at the hotel restaurants were good as well. We ended up dining at the Hyatt restaurants for most of our stay because of the 15% discount that you get for staying at the hotel. We ate at Ruinas del Mar, Palms, and the Italian restaurant (forgot the name) and we were pretty happy with the service and the food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again when we come back.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was exactly what I wanted it to be. Great room, great service, great breakfast, and great location. Concierge was helpful in making restaurant reservations and dinner reservations. Had no problem with pool chairs or beach chairs. We had a wonderful vacation.
reviews.title: Go for it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent stay at the Hyatt after a much needed getaway from our four kids. When originally bookingthe hotel and I also received the comment from my wife "no sit out balcony's, you need to figure that one out". Called the hotel directly and booked the least expensive suite. Upon entering this amazing lobby, I knew we were in store for an excellent stay. We were sent up to suite 745, all I could say it wow! Direct ocean front, killer room, regency club access and a great balcony. Most comfortable bed and pillows, awesome shower, 42in plasma etc.... Also looked at the regularrooms which were nice, although small- you really don't spend that much time in your room.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in the Resort Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We pre reserved a hut through Hyatt for a small charge, although the hotel was quite, it was great to have your designated spot for the week, great idea and well worth it. My favorite part about Aruba is the water, loved chilling out on the rafts all day and reading
reviews.title: Yes it really does look like the photos!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed Thanksgiving week with husband and two daughters(16 and 11) and enjoyed our stay with some caveats. It was not crowded when we first arrived prior to Thanksksgiving, and we got a palapa no problem withoout having to reserve one early in the a.m However after two days and sensing the growing crowds, we opted to rent our shade and were glad we did. I don't agree with this, but space is limited (although there was always some space under the communal palapa it can get crowded). The water had a high level of turbidity and we could not see our feet even when shallow. Went to baby beach and it was equally disappointing. The pool does get crowded, but we are not pool people so went at end of day to get refreshed and by then plenty of chairs available. The pool is small, so if you just hang by the pool you might not love it here. We opted not to go on a snorkeling trip b/c others at the hotel us it was underwhelming. We rented a car (very easy to get around) and thought Arashi Beach and Malmok looked pleasant and there were snorkelers out in the water. The island is quite dirty (garbage just being tossed everywhere) and dry and rather unattractive. That being said, the Hyatt common areas are really lovely. The Aruban people are incredibly kind and friendly and go out of their way to please the tourists (even the rude ones!). Our rooms were pleasant, clean and comfortable. The food was also okay..Thanksgiving buffet was really nice, Japenga was enjoyable and the breakfast buffet is only worth it if it is included in your room. Otherwise it would probably make more sense to go off for breakfast as there are many restaurants within walking distance. Lots of people brought sandwiches from Subway to eat on the beach, which is probably a good affordable way to eat lunch. Food was generally ok...the best was Gianni's. The butterfly farm was fun, very peaceful, pretty and educational. Lots of motorboat activity on the beach and the water was refreshingly cool (80-82) after sitting on the beach. We took long walks on the beach...you can walk way down in either direction. Virtually no shells to speak of up near the Hyatt, but found some down towards Eagle beach. The water looked clearer their too. On the whole it is kind of like Miami Beach with more reliable weather and slightly nicer water. Lots of great people watching and languages from all over the world. Not gamblers so I can't comment on Casino. They had a great band playing one night...and a guitar playing singer on another couple of nights. It was a good place to go to recharge our batteries, but I wouldn't go back. I would go to Grand Cayman for snorkeling and nature diversions and Turks and Caicos or Bahamas for much prettier beaches. If you are going to stay on Aruba I think the Hyatt is a good choice if you want to be in the thick of things...we felt safe walking around and the Hyatt has good security on premises. Hallway noise surprisingly loud, but Hotel quiet at night...ask to be away from ice machine and elevators if you are a light sleeper and like to sleep late wear earplugs! I am not uploading photos b/c all previous ones are very accurate.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay depends on what you are looking for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in September at the Hyatt, celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary, and we're glad we did. The hotel grounds, the pool, our room, and customer service were all spectacular. Only complaint is the beach/palapa/raft issue... if you want your own private palapa, you do have to get up early and reserve one. For us, it wasn't that big of a deal since each day we were out doing other things. And people can get nasty over the limited supply of rafts... and you had to pay for internet... BUT all else considered, we were very happy with our stay. This hotel is good for people who don't mind spending a bit more money for a nicer stay - not exactly a Ritz-Carlton, but a comfortable, clean, aesthetically pleasing experience. We ate at their Asian restaurant (forgot the name) and had Sunday brunch there. Both were excellent. The hotel and staff really exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, two daughters (ages 15 & 12) and I arrived at the Hyatt Regency, Aruba on Thanksgiving afternoon. The property is centrally located, well kept, and has a beautiful pool area. The resort was near capacity, as expected on a holiday weekend. However what I did not expect was the poor management of pool lounge chairs and beach chairs/tiki huts. All pool space and beach chairs are taken by 8:30 in the morning by guests who get up at literally the crack of dawn and get in line. (A gentleman in the gym told me he was on line at 7:30 and there were 40 people in front of him.) Guests line up to get towels that are then placed on chairs. The chairs are then "theirs" for the day. So when you come down to the pool or beach at 8:00, all you see are unoccupied chairs with towels on them. People place towels on chairs at both the pool and the beach to reserve their space. One of the cabana gentleman told me this is how it is done. Well this is not how it should be done! The Hyatt in Maui will remove towels placed on unoccupied chairs. As a result there is never an issue of no space. People come and go all day and chairs are always available. The Hyatt Aruba is poorly manged. All guests are entitled to a lounge chair and shade.
